ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4

Class GL4RenderSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4.GL4RenderSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener, java.util.EventListener, Disposable, RenderSystem

    public final class GL4RenderSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements RenderSystem, com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener
    An OpenGL 4-specific implementation of the render-system interface, using the Java OpenGL bindings to interact with the graphics hardware.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ray.rage.rendersystem.RenderSystem

        public void setHUD(java.lang.String string,
                   int x,
                   int y)
        Description copied from interface: RenderSystem
        Sets the Heads-Up-Display (HUD #1) to the specified string at the specified location. The X and Y location is (0,0) at the lower left of the window.
        Specified by:

        Description copied from interface: RenderSystem
        Sets the Heads-Up-Display (HUD #1) to the specified string. The location of the string does not change, or it is at the default location.

        Description copied from interface: RenderSystem

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        rq - The render-queue with the renderables to be rendered.
        view - The view matrix.
        proj - The projection matrix.

      • swapBuffers

        public void swapBuffers()
        Description copied from interface: RenderSystem
        Gets the render-system to swap the front and back buffers in order to display a completed scene.

        Drawing operations take place in an off-screen buffer, called the "back buffer", in order to avoid displaying scenes that are only partially drawn and other artifacts (e.g. flickering) to the viewer. See Multiple Buffering in Computer Graphics.

        Specified by:
        swapBuffers in interface RenderSystem

      • createGpuShaderProgram

        public GpuShaderProgram createGpuShaderProgram(GpuShaderProgram.Type type)
        Description copied from interface: RenderSystem
        Creates a render-system-specific shader-program meant to be associated with a renderable.

        GPU shader-programs are required to render renderables. Any renderable submitted to the render-system without an associated shader-program will be logged and skipped.

        Specified by:
        createGpuShaderProgram in interface RenderSystem
        Parameters:
        type - type.
        Returns:
        A shader-program.

      • getGpuShaderProgram

        public GpuShaderProgram getGpuShaderProgram(GpuShaderProgram.Type type)

        Specified by:
        getGpuShaderProgram in interface RenderSystem
        Parameters:
        type - The type used when creating the shader-program.
        Returns:
        The shader-program.
        See Also:

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
